revised_title: Non-Haem Proteins in Monkey Erythrocytes: Genetic Inheritance and Species Identification
tldr: The authors discovered two non-haem proteins, Y and Z, in the erythrocytes of various monkey species. These proteins help differentiate between species and individuals. The distribution of Y and Z proteins is determined by allelic genes, and there is no correlation with sex or geographical origin. The proteins are absent in foetal erythrocytes but appear during infancy alongside adult haemoglobin.
